Sorry - text missing. I see a snippet asking me to upgrade and have about: page telling me I am up to date with 8.0.1
Confusing for users.

lforrest@mozilla.com
comments.text:
This is bizarre - Barbara has the 3.6 start page but is running the most recent build. 

Barbara also told me she has never reset her default homepage within her Fx profile. I believe all users who upgraded from 3.6 to Fx4 and above should see the new start page. 

Let's make sure this isn't a widespread problem. The old about:home page has outdated design, and these users are heavily prompted to upgrade to a more recent version of Firefox.
comments.author: lforrest@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
This is bizarre - Barbara has the 3.6 start page but is running the most recent build. 

Barbara also told me she has never reset her default homepage within her Fx profile. I believe all users who upgraded from 3.6 to Fx4 and above should see the new start page. 

Let's make sure this isn't a widespread problem. The old about:home page has outdated design, and these users are heavily prompted to upgrade to a more recent version of Firefox.
What's the value of the browser.startup.homepage pref in about:config?
comments.author: mak@mozilla.com
comments.text: What's the value of the browser.startup.homepage pref in about:config?
comments.creator: mak@mozilla.com

comments.author: mak@mozilla.com

comments.author: bhueppe@mozilla.com
comments.text:
browser.startup.homepage;user set, string, http://de.start3.mozilla.com/firefox?client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official

browser.startup.page, user set, integer;3

visiting chrome:// ...  I see: browser.startup.homepage=about:home
comments.raw_text:
browser.startup.homepage;user set, string, http://de.start3.mozilla.com/firefox?client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official

browser.startup.page, user set, integer;3

visiting chrome:// ...  I see: browser.startup.homepage=about:home

(In reply to bhueppe from comment #7)
> browser.startup.homepage;user set, string,
> http://de.start3.mozilla.com/firefox?client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:
> official

This means that for some reason your home page got set to this value "manually". This could have happened if you selected "use current page" while visiting that page at some point. Is that possible?

I'm not sure how this could have happened otherwise.
comments.creator: gavin.sharp@gmail.com

This means that for some reason your home page got set to this value "manually". This could have happened if you selected "use current page" while visiting that page at some point. Is that possible?

I'm not sure how this could have happened otherwise.

comments.raw_text: Maybe. I will change the setting and let you know it happens again.
